alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 5:25AM EDT until March 28 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Baldwin, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River at Milledgeville. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 30 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand further into the woodlands and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage near the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. Fishing Creek backs up and a few buildings along the creek will be flooded. Also Tanyard Branch Stream between East Thomas and East Charleston Streets in Milledgeville will flood. Sinclair Dam will likely have four to five gates open to reach this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 29.3 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM EDT Tuesday was 30.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this morning to 10.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then rise to 14.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall to 11.3 feet Friday morning. It will then rise to 13.2 feet Friday evening. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 22 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
